have plenty of time for questions let's start with some background on Amazon workspace uh in
Amazon workspace is very simply a desktop that you stream from the cloud so for end users it feels very much like
uh the same type of Windows Experience that they have running on a local laptop or local desktop you can connect to it
from a lot of different device types and from different locations uh so that your applications and data are always
available to you uh today when you think about providing enduser Computing to uh
your internal customers uh from an IT perspective you're probably thinking about providing them with a laptop or
desktop or PC uh that's a managed device uh and providing that along with access
to a corporate Network which is a trusted Network that has access to your corporate data uh at Amazon workspaces
we have a very different vision for the future of enduser computing we believe there's a way that you can provide
Solutions uh for your end users which are going to give them more flexibility and uh more choice in the way that they
compute uh that provides them a greater level of security and protects your corporate data more effectively uh and
which is a lot simpler for you to administer all while providing a lower total cost cost of ownership uh for your
enduser Computing environments in short we believe that in the future you're going to be providing a cloud desktop to
your end users we believe that a larger percentage of those end users are going to bring their own devices uh so they're
going to be bringing devices from home to connect with that they own uh we believe that uh you're going to shift
the way that you think about your network uh and your corporate Network and have less trust in your network and
assume that uh the ports uh and the wireless access points that make up your corporate network uh are as untrusted as
a Wi-Fi in a in a coffee shop uh and so uh we also believe that looking
backwards we're going to find that some of the security decisions we made in the past within user Computing are going to look a little strange uh so today end
users are putting data on devices and walking out the front door of your building with that data every day uh
today end users are mingling their own personal applications their personal lives their personal security decisions
into a device that you're providing with for them and then they're connecting that to your trusted Computing Network
and have access to your corporate data uh I think in retrospect CSI are going to find that to be a very strange model
looking backwards the good news is uh for Amazon workspaces customers we're actually able to execute on a lot of
this Vision today and so obviously Jeff's going to talk about how J&J is doing that uh we've got thousands of
other customers who are also doing the same thing today so let's start by talking a little
bit about some of the customer challenges we were trying to solve with Amazon workspaces so uh our customers are very
frequently folks who've already looked at vdi uh they appreciate the management value that vdi brings they want to
provide that type of solution uh but they found that uh trying to fulfill that dream is pretty challenging so
actually executing on building a Global infrastructure to support in users uh at
scale is is a pretty big problem for them uh we're also hearing from customers that they're seeing this
increase in the popularity of bring your own device models so a proliferation of different devices maybe unmanaged

diversity of Workforce so that is there's a lot more users who are uh
working from remote locations remote offices uh and there might be more seasonality to those workers so lots of
Consultants of variable Workforce uh and so for those types of users a traditional desktop model where you
issue a laptop issue a PC build out a corporate Network to every location uh may not be the ideal
solution we're also seeing a lot of tablet adoption and so there's a lot of confusion from customers on how best do
I provide my windows applications to tablet users uh and they need some sort of solution that uh gets there today not
in the future uh and then of course uh all of these are areas where it becomes more challenging uh to keep the desktop
environment secure so you've got a lot more diversity in the environment you've got a lot of challenges in that front
so to address those challenges uh we've taken vdi into the cloud with Amazon
workspaces so when we launched Amazon workspaces one of the most surprising things for us was how many of our
customers told us the experience of using their Amazon workspace was much better than the experience of using
their on premises vdi Solutions even when they'd spent a large amount of time trying to optimize those solutions for
user experience uh what they found was that once they decided to deploy BDI
that the challenge of uh building out a global infrastructure uh for an effective user experience is actually a
very real challenge so you've got to buy and build servers you've got to tune the workloads of those servers for the
specifics of those desktop environments you expect to support you've got to build out a disc infrastructure with Nas
and sand that's at a low level of latency and high throughput you've got to provide a networking environment uh
in your data centers to handle the streaming uh and so those uh get to be a really big challenges for a single Data
Center and then if you think about having a global Workforce that needs that in multiple regions it becomes uh
significantly more complicated so with Amazon
workspaces we are able to leverage and take advantage of the huge Global infrastructure that AWS has already
built to solve a lot of these problems Amazon workspaces is built on top of Technologies like ec2 EBS VPC Direct
Connect uh and those Technologies already have lot of the core characteristics you really want to see
in a broad effective Global vdi infrastructure and so as a customer you get to take advantage of that scale and
that performance whether you're launching one workspace or 10,000 workspaces and whether you're connecting
from one office or if you're connecting from around the
globe so if you're a workspace as customer you simply start by launching however many workspaces you need to
launch from our console or from the apis we handle all of the heavy lifting
associated with standing up that infrastructure so we provision the workspace we make sure that it has the
correct networking as you've defined it to be uh we make sure that it has the right dis and that dis is always going
to be available uh and your endusers simply get an email pointing them to their new workspace they download the
clients they install and connect to their workspace you can start this with
as little as one workspace and then scale as your business scales
so Amazon workspaces is very simply a Windows 2008 R2 server providing a
windows7 client desktop experience so from an Administration perspective all
of the existing tools that you use today to administer your existing desktops uh are going to work just fine on top of
Amazon workspaces so tools like secm are going to work fine for uh deployments
and for management uh on top of that existing environment uh as well as then extending into Amazon
workspaces at the same time Amazon workspaces can be integrated with your uh on premises active directory
Solutions uh so whatever your existing corporate directory infrastructure looks like your workspaces can be part of that
so when you launch a new workspace it gets domain joined directly into uh your existing environment that means your
users get to log in using their existing username and password for Windows uh it means they have access to all of the
corporate assets that you've already built out for desktop users whether that's exchange or SharePoint or share
drives uh all of those are going to be available it also means uh that tools like group policy that you use to
administer and config your uh Windows desktops and environments are going to work fine for
workspaces as we've talked to customers we found that every one of them has a slightly different approach to defining
what types of applications what types of data and what types of configuration they want to have in the workspaces uh
that they're running and so to help uh customers with that sort of mass customization process uh we have a
feature called custom images or custom bundles Uh custom bundles simply let you
modify the golden image that's used to launch the workspaces uh for your end users so from an administrator's
perspective you're very simply taking uh a workspace launching it configuring the
applications that you want configuring uh the data that you want in and then setting up any config uh and validating
that you're happy with that snapshotting it and then using that as the basis for new workspaces launches and then if you
want to create more custom bundles and have them for different groups you can do that so you have lots of different uh
options for custom bundles for your end
users so let's take a little bit of a a deep dive on uh how we keep your data secure and available uh and uh have a
secure access approach Ro to get into your workspace when a user connects to
an Amazon workspace uh that authentication process is completed over an SSL encrypted Channel then once we
start the streaming all of the streaming data is encrypted using aes256
encryption so all that's coming out from the workspace and going to the client is
an encrypted pixel stream of the video output there's no data that ever lives on a client device what that means is if
a client device has ever lost lost none of your data is ever lost with that client device there's also no way to get
the data from the stream as it's happening because it's encrypted it's also important to
recognize that our users control the network access for each workspace each
workspace shows up as a managed endpoint in your VPC which means that all of the existing tools uh like security groups
that you use to manage those endpoints apply to workspaces so you decide whether the workspace is going to have n
access to your corporate data or Internet uh and it's up to you uh how you'd like that to be applied in
addition to keeping your corporate data secure and making sure that the workspaces uh are secure we also want to
make sure you always have access to the data that you've got in the cloud associated with your workspace so uh the
data store for each workspace is EBS uh so each workspace has an EBS volume that
means it's got high performance and low latency characteristics and high availability characteristics and we all
Al then take that EBS volume and snapshot it every 12 hours uh so you get a snapshot to S3 which means if you ever
need some sort of recovery or backup we do have that data as
well for customers uh looking for a little bit more Security in the authentication process uh we also uh uh
support multiactor authentication so that means you can use your uh existing one-time password mechanisms to connect
and authenticate to your work workspaces so uh if you've got a radius infrastructure uh will support passing
through the one-time passwords directly to that infrastructure uh for many workspaces
users we find that this effectively replaces the VPN uh that they've been using in the past uh so that is they'll
take an enduser device install the workspace as client on it uh and then uh when they authenticate use their
username and password typically their Windows username and password from ad pass in a one-time password then we're
doing SSL encrypted communication uh to O and then doing the as 256 encrypted
streaming which means that they don't effectively need a VPN client
anymore all right so let's pull all this together a little bit so this is an example architecture diagram uh that

off session gateways which is the red box uh up above uh in the right hand section uh and they're going to be again

active directory on premises implementation for the password
authentication it's also going to be passing through the onetime password which will reach out to your radius uh
